intro: Pterotropia, commonly known as the false dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. These plants are characterized by their composite flower heads, which consist of both ray and disk flowers. Pterotropia species typically have alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy or pubescent. They are native to various regions in the Americas and are often found in moist, open habitats. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in traditional medicine.
